SPICEY 0.99.0
  • Reference

Run the SPICEY pipeline

Source: R/run_spicey.R
run_spicey.Rd

This function runs the SPICEY pipeline for scoring and linking regulatory elements (REs) and genes based on single-cell ATAC-seq and RNA-seq data. It supports two linking strategies: co-accessibility-based and nearest-gene annotation.

Usage

run_spicey(
  atac_path,
  rna_path,
  links_path = NULL,
  linking_method = c("coaccessibility", "nearest")
)

Arguments

atac_path

Path to the RDS file containing ATAC-seq data as a GRanges or data.frame convertible to GRanges.

rna_path

Path to the RDS file containing RNA-seq data as a GRanges or data.frame convertible to GRanges.

links_path

Optional path to the RDS file containing co-accessibility links as a data.frame. Required if linking_method = "coaccessibility".

linking_method

Linking method to use; either "coaccessibility" or "nearest".

Value

A data.frame containing annotated REs with RETSI/GETSI scores, entropy, and linked gene information. The returned table will include RETSI scores and entropy for each region, and GETSI scores and entropy for the linked genes according to the chosen linking strategy.

Details

  • RETSI: Regulatory Element Tissue Specificity Index.

  • GETSI: Gene Expression Tissue Specificity Index.

  • When using "coaccessibility" mode, the function reads a precomputed link file and performs RETSI/GETSI scoring, linking, and merging.

  • When using "nearest" mode, the function links each RE to its nearest gene and merges GETSI scores accordingly.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Co-accessibility-based linking
run_spicey(
  atac_path = "data/FINAL_ATAC.rds",
  rna_path = "data/FINAL_RNA.rds",
  links_path = "data/COACC_LINKS.rds",
  linking_method = "coaccessibility"
)

# Nearest-gene-based linking
run_spicey(
  atac_path = "data/FINAL_ATAC.rds",
  rna_path = "data/FINAL_RNA.rds",
  linking_method = "nearest"
)
} # }
